creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
department: Art of Africa and the Americas
description: Head, architectural in character, of the type known as 'Hacha'. Sharply-cut features with large nose, deep-cut eyes, and lipless mouth turned up in a grin. Large scroll forms in relief at temples and on cheek. Cap-like headdress comes forward over the brow in a large puff.
title: Hacha
